file_content.text: I heard Command's planning an attack on an Imperial training camp. Maybe I can get a place in the squad. See you 'round.
Sergeant Jolis. I have the databanks, and all gun batteries are down.
That means I can get back up in the air again. Plus, I managed to pick off a few Imperials!
Hopefully this is the start of a distinguished career.
Well done, Sergeant.
I'll sure try my best.
There'll be a lot more of that, believe me.
Feels good, doesn't it?
I sure hope so. I can't wait to take the fight to those Imperial scum.
They must have been too busy running from me.
Really? Were their eyes shut?
Maybe. They certainly looked scared!
With those guns out of the way, we can get the fleet operational again. Payback time.
Have you got those hard drives yet? And the AA guns? Sooner we get this sorted, the sooner I can get back in the air.
Ugh. How do I change the power pack...?
Sir? My training hasn't covered this type of weaponry yet. Can you show me how to use it?
Master Jedi? You probably think guns are barbaric, but can you show me how to use this?
Excuse me--do you have any idea how to use this gun?
I'm taking the fight to those Imperial scumbags. I owe it to my squadron.
What happened to your squadron?
Your squadron?
Who are you?
Sergeant Jolis. I just got my stripes last week. Seems I'm a bit of a jinx, though. My first mission out and look what happened.
Looks like you'll shoot yourself in the foot before you can do anything useful.
Yeah--really bad idea.
Maybe you're right. I mean, I only just got my stripes. But I have to do something!
Now they're salvaging our fliers' databanks. They've got our weapons specs, orders, briefings, everything.
I have to get those databanks back and take out the guns. Trouble is, the place is guarded by shock troops, real hard-core fighters.
You're not experienced enough for a mission this dangerous. Let me take your place.
You need my help.
I don't know. I really want to do something to stick it to the Empire.
But maybe you're right. There's more chance of success if you do it. Then I can get back up in my fighter.
If success was judged on determination, your task would be complete.
Your bravery does you credit.
You've got guts, I'll say that. No brains, but lots of guts.
That's some backbone, kid.
If all our soldiers were as brave as you, this war might already be won.
I like your attitude, son.
Thank you. I know there's a chance I'll die, but I have to do something.
What else can I do? I have to do something.
Still, since you're here... we could team up?
What if you went in and took care of the vets, and I wait here to deal with any you flush out? That way we're all doing our bit?
Gladly.
Watch and learn.
I hope you're right.
Just hurry? The Empire will fight to the last breath to keep those databanks. If they manage to decode them... mine won't be the last dead squadron.
Sorry. [Refuse quest]
That's okay. Can't expect others to fight my battles for me. See you when I come out.
Sorry--bit busy right now. Now which button is for grenades?
You'll be taken out as soon as you step into the junkyard.
That's a suicide mission!
Command gave me a place in the squadron. We're heading out once they've made sure the junkyard is clean.
That junkyard out there? It's where the Empire has its anti-aircraft guns hidden. We were flying into battle when they shot us down.
Sergeant Jolis = good master // N5 - Sergeant Jolis = could not compute // N5 = grateful for assistance
Sergeant Jolis + N5 = not programmed for combat // Sergeant Jolis = should seek shelter now
Sergeant Jolis' squadron = attempted strike on Imperial outpost // Outpost = equipped with anti-aircraft artillery // Sergeant Jolis = sole survivor
Empire = many men // Sergeant Jolis = one man // Empire + Sergeant Jolis = one dead man
That's a suicide mission!
Sergeant Jolis vs. Empire = calculating // Results = certain death // N5 = run calculations again?
